cover_prompt: A young woman sits on the floor of a cluttered, sun-drenched attic, intently examining a faded protest banner, her expression a mix of curiosity and resolve, [Detailed Scene & Context: The scene is rich with intergenerational artifacts; open cardboard boxes spill 1970s feminist zines, political buttons, and handwritten journals alongside modern laptop and smartphone, symbolizing the clash and connection of eras. Domestic items—a vintage iron, a plate with a forgotten sandwich—are juxtaposed with radical ephemera, framing the domestic as a political archive], [Artistic Style & Medium: in the detailed, narrative-rich style of domestic surrealism akin to Elena Gual's paintings, with the textured, layered collage sensibility of Jessie Makinson, rendered in matte acrylic and delicate ink lines on heavy paper], [Composition & Camera: book cover framing, a centered and intimate composition with a slightly elevated angle looking down into the attic space, creating a sense of excavation and discovery, the central subject connected to a periphery of symbolic objects], [Lighting & Color Palette: warm, dusty afternoon light streams through a single attic window, creating strong shafts of illumination that highlight the central figure and specific artifacts, casting deep, nostalgic shadows; color palette of faded terracotta, ochre, cream, and sage green, punctuated by the bold vermillion of the old banner], [Quality & Technical Enforcers: masterpiece, best quality, ultra detailed, intricate details, professional composition, sharp focus, 8k resolution, flux dev].
